🔧 Projects

Here are a few things I’ve built recently. I encourage anyone who’s curious to dig in and figure out a new tool or app. Making something that you can share with the world–however simple it may be–is deeply satisfying.

  • Career Blues
    My podcast where guests and I riff on the meaning of work and the Good Life. Coming March 2020.

  • FinTwit Store
    My first-ever Shopify store! This one offers print-on-demand products for members of the Finance Twitter community.

  • Quotebot
    A bot that collects pithy quotes submitted by my friends and I into an Airtable base, then posts them to Twitter via a Zapier integration. You can submit a quote here if you have a good one that comes to mind!

  • Scott’s Links
    A collection of my favorite essays and blogposts. Built using no-code website builder Webflow.

  • Scott Reads Poetry
    I read poems for your enjoyment. The goal is to test my equipment and learn how to produce a podcast. I’m currently using Anchor.fm to publish the recordings. Check out my readings, and let me know what you think!

  • Springs Beer
    A no-code mobile app I built using Glide that lists name, location, and contact info for all local breweries in Colorado Springs, Colorado. Users may save Favorites and to post reviews of each establishment. This was a fun mini-project! You could very easily make one for your town by cloning my app. Look for a tutorial soon!

  • scottscharl.com
    I built this site using Jekyll, a static website framework, and host it for free on Github Pages. This is my first-ever attempt at a web development project. It’s been fascinating to learn the rudiments of command line, HTML, CSS, Javascript, YAML data files, and more. I’ll be improving the site’s aesthetics and functionality over time as my knowledge grows, as well as adding new posts to my blog. I am indebted to Chuck Grimmett for his inspiration and for this helpful list of Jekyll resources he created for me.

  • jcscharl.com
    I built my wife a writer website on Wordpress. An embedded Airtable allows her to quickly update lists of published poems and articles.

  • Days Until Christmas
    This one’s silly. I built Twitter bot that posts, daily, the number of days remaninng until Christmas.
